isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE SYMPTOMS DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Low Oil Pressure

item.para: Instrument panel gauge error
Low oil level: oil leak, oil consumption or incorrect servicing
High oil level: incorrect servicing, fuel in oil or coolant in oil
Incorrect oil viscosity
Fuel in oil
Stuck oil pressure regulator
Scored/damaged oil pump
Engine Oil Pressure (EOP) sensor biased
Missing oil gallery plugs (front or rear)
Broken, missing or loose piston cooling tube(s)
Missing, damaged or worn bearing inserts or camshaft bushings
Lifter missing (will also have performance problems)
Aeration (cracked pickup tube, missing O-ring)

step1.para: Verify oil level in engine by using oil level gauge while vehicle is parked on level ground. Check to see if oil is contaminated with fuel or coolant.

item.para: Engine oil level will vary depending on temperature of engine
If oil is contaminated, go to Fuel in Lube Oil or Coolant in Lube Oil test procedures located in this section.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following;
When routing test line , do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.
To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following;
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Verify oil pressure using a known good mechanical gauge installed at the lube oil pressure test port at the front of the engine. Measure pressure at both low and high idle no load. Engine must be at operating temperature.

item.para: If oil pressure reads within specification listed in Appendix A in this Manual, compare mechanical gauge readings with instrument panel gauge and Engine Oil Pressure (EOP) value on the Electronic Service Tool (EST).

If mechanical gauge and EST read values with a difference greater than +/- 14 kPa (+/-2 psi) perform Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics for the EOP circuit as described in Section 7 in this Manual.
If instrument panel engine oil pressure gauge reads a different value than the EST and mechanical gauge refer to the Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide for the model and year of vehicle.
If oil pressure does not read within the specification listed in Appendix A in this Manual, continue to step 3.

step1.para: Remove and inspect the lube oil pump as described in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: Inspect the lube oil pump housing and cover for gouging or deep scratches.
Inspect the gerotor gears for excessive wear or damage.
If no excessive damage is found continue to step 4.

step1.para: Remove and inspect oil pressure regulator as described in the Engine Service Manual.

item.para: The oil pressure regulator piston should move freely in its bore in the front cover.

If oil pressure regulator is functional and passes visual inspection, reinstall regulator, gerotor gears, pump cover, and damper following the procedures in the Engine Service Manual. Retest following the Low Oil Pressure Diagnostics procedures in step 2. If oil pressure remains low, do step 5.

step1.para: Drain oil from engine using a clean catch basin. Inspect oil drain plug magnet, drained oil and oil filter for foreign debris.

item.para: An oil sample should be taken to determine level of engine wear metals and contaminants in the oil.

step1.para: Remove both the upper and lower oil pans as described in the Engine Service Manual. Inspect for missing, loose or damaged oil pickup tube, O-ring, piston cooling tubes, bearing inserts, and cam bushings.
Reinstall oil filter cap without oil filter.
Connect fuel/oil pressure test coupler to a regulated shop air line.
Connect to lube oil pressure test port and apply 345 kPa (50 psi).

item.para: If a major leak is observed from the front cover area, go to step 11.
If a major leak is observed from the rear cover area, go to step 13.
If a major leak is not observed, remove engine from vehicle. Disassemble engine and perform full inspection of all components following procedures in the Engine Service Manual.

step1.para: Remove the front cover from the engine following procedures in the Engine Service Manual and complete inspection of the lube oil pump.

figure.caption: Main Oil Gallery Cup Plug Locations

step1.para: With front cover removed from the engine, verify that the main oil gallery cup plugs are in position and not damaged.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, the engine must be supported before removing rear cover or engine.

figure.caption: Rear Main Oil Gallery Cup Plug Locations

step1.para: Remove the rear cover from the engine as described in the Engine Service Manual. Verify the rear main oil gallery cup plugs are in position and not damaged.
